newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: BHP sees Australasia steel demand rising.
newsitem.headline: BHP sees Australasia steel demand rising.

text.p: Australian steel-maker, The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd (BHP), on Monday said it expected current flat demand for steel in Australia and New Zealand to improve.
BHP Steel chief executive Ron McNeilly told a briefing seminar that the group saw "increasing expectations demand is going to improve".
Conditions now in Australasia remain flat both in terms of demand and price, he said.
Last Friday, BHP announced a 1996/97 (June-May) net profit of A$410 million, 60.8 percent lower than the year-ago level after abnormal writedowns of A$976 million.

It said the abnormal losses included a write-down in some North American copper assets of A$550 million, a writedown in steel assets of A$220 million and a writedown in minerals assets of A$189 million.
